data.title: Open Again just as good
data.text: A long time after the fire but open again across the street on Davis.  Same excellent selection of tasty tacos and good margaritas (still not by the pitcher though). Noisy though and hard to talk with friends.

data.title: Taco Diablo Returns!
data.text:
Anyone that had the pleasure of eating here before their fire a few years ago will be happy for their return, and new comers will be excited for a new Mexican restaurant in Evanston.  
The space is kind of industrial/cantina decor, big booths and a great looking "rustic' bar set the tone.
We tried a few appetizers and shared a taco plate (3 different types from a long list) and a the chiliquilies 
Overall a great dinner, look forward to going back

data.title: Fun atmosphere, great variety of  tacos
data.text:
Our group enjoyed the lamb, crispy fish and spicy shrimp tacos. Your choice of 3 for $15.  Several other items on the menu. Nice new space with large bar.  Street parking and public lot very close by.

Advice: Don't sit in the corner booth next to the door that provides access to the separate rooftop restaurant. Lots of people coming in and out.

data.title: Better than ever, this eclectic taco place offers the best.
data.text: Fantastic, delicious, inventive, and fun.  Taco Diablo  has risen from the ashes (of a fire), across the street and is so delicious. Plus there is a Five and dime rooftop dining space just above it.  Today they had a lunch specials -  my choice of any 2 tacos alongside a lovely salad.  I chose crispy fish tacos and chicken mole but they ALL sounded good. Nice chips and 2 different salsas and my meal was complete.  The place was hopping so get there and taste the fun.

data.title: Fun Mexican spot
data.text: This small restaurant has a colorful, happy atmosphere, and reliably good menu choices. The staff is always friendly. It gets very crowded, however, and doesn't take reservations.

data.title: Good but always raising their prices...
data.text:
Dear Taco Diablo,
Just a few observations - we eat here a lot and are local Evanstonians and enjoy Taco Diablo.  But it's more than a little annoying that seemingly every time we come in, you have tweaked your prices (up) and you've only been around a year and a half.   In that time, your 3-taco combo has gone up a couple of bucks; your drink prices have sky-rocketed since you opened (margaritas now @ $9...used to be $6-something); beers, same thing; your torta sandwiches, up $2 from when you opened.   How about you try keeping your menu and prices the same for a year so your customers don't feel like you are trying to nickle and dime the prices up every few months?  We still like your food and the atmosphere is great, but this is the type of thing that can grate on your regulars over time...so keep this in mind as it's definitely noticed.

data.title: A Solid 3.5 for Mexican Food in Evanston
data.text: Wife and I visited a week ago and found a really cool space.  We were welcomed with brick walls and a cool wood ceiling.  Started at the bar with a couple of margaritas which were tasty, but not special.  The food is solid, the potato taco is delicious as others have mentioned.  The tacos I think were better than the mole.  This is a solid neighborhood spot and a great place for a Mexican fix.

data.title: Intimately casual, creative
data.text: Taco Diablo is in a small space (former Turin bike factory, I think), has a limited menu that is well thought out, fresh and creative.  Tasty tacos with fillings like lamb, crispy duck, catfish, carne asada, etc.  Good salads and  Mexican inspired entree dishes, too. Easy to drop in, can eat at small bar, warm and friendly service, good beer menu.  I always look forward to going there for a quick or not so quick bite of tasty and non-typical combinations.

data.title: Good Food. Friendly Place.
data.text:
The tacos were delicious. I had the three taco plate (try the potato taco - yum!) and my hubby had the carnitas torta (he said it was good, but I seemed to be into my tacos a bit more). If you're into tacos, this is a great place to see what an innovative/talented chef can do with one. They have few tacos on the menu, but each with great flavor combinations.
The restaurant is clean, which is #1 priority for me. The decor is cool and uncluttered. The service was very friendly. And they were very warm and welcoming to my 1yr. old. They may not naturally get lots of kids, but they were super cool when we walked in. High chairs and all. 
I will be back.

data.title: Taco Diablo: Authentic Mexican Food at its Best!
data.text:
I ate at Taco Diablo a few weeks ago and I had the same appetizer and meal and it was outstanding. The Puebla Mole Sauce is really awesome on the chicken enchiladas and the guacamole is superb. I work in Mexico a lot and in Puebla City, and I can tell you that this was real authentic-tasting mole sauce. To top it off, they have great margaritas and an excellent selection of beers. I like the atmosphere as well. Nice wall art. I give this restaurant a five fork rating, which is the highest you can get from me on a rating scale

Matthew
Evanston, IL

data.title: good but pricey
data.text: Found the tacos to be very good and interesting.  Lots of different flavors; but aware that everything comes out family style.  The service was a bit slow and I thought that it was very pricey, yet would go back.  They have lunch specials so I would probably wait to go back and take advantage of one.

data.title: Original and tasty tacos
data.text: We love the lunch special with two tacos and a sald. They also have great margaritas, a nice beer list and solid guacamole.

data.title: A potato taco? Don't think twice - order it
data.text: Flavored beautifully. Accompanied with spicy shrimp and catfish tacos and black beans it made for a delicious lunch. The French press coffee (were those Mexican beans?) was an unexpected way to serve in this kind of restaurant and I responded with Pavlovian weekend kind of comfort.
